meanings.definition: The act of giving life or vitality to something.
meanings.sent1: The vivifications of the garden brought forth colorful flowers and buzzing bees.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the power of vivifications to revive the old traditions.
meanings.sent3: The vivifications of the party turned it into a lively dance-off.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had the vivifications of a magical spell, captivating everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The vivifications of the music filled the room with energy and joy.

meanings.definition: The process of making something more lively or animated.
meanings.sent1: The vivifications in the painting made the characters seem almost real.
meanings.sent2: The vivifications in her speech captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: The vivifications in the movie turned the dull plot into an exciting adventure.
meanings.sent4: His jokes had the vivifications of making even the grumpiest person smile.
meanings.sent5: The vivifications in the room increased as the children played and laughed together.
